attacks.name: Green Dance
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Grass Pokémon, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. If you put any Grass Pokémon into your hand, you may switch Bellossom with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Full Bloom
attacks.text: If you have at least 3 Bellossom in play, this attack does 50 damage plus 50 more damage.

attacks.name: Fire Dance
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Fire Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Multi Burn
attacks.text: If Flareon has 3 or more different types of basic Energy cards attached to it, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

ability.name: Burning Aura
ability.text: As long as Typhlosion is your Active Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on each Active Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) between turns.

attacks.name: Flickering Flames
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 50 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Typhlosion.

ability.name: Stages of Evolution
ability.text: As long as Hitmonlee is an Evolved Pokémon, Hitmonlee's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Stretch Kick
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Mega Kick
attacks.text: n/a

ability.name: Baby Evolution
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Jynx from your hand onto Smoochum (this counts as evolving Smoochum) and remove all damage counters from Smoochum.

attacks.name: Blown Kiss
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

ability.name: Baby Evolution
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Hitmonlee, Hitmonchan, or Hitmontop from your hand onto Tyrogue (this counts as evolving Tyrogue) and remove all damage counters from Tyrogue.

attacks.name: Desperate Punch
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of Pokémon in play your opponent has more than you.

ability.name: Snappy Move
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Aipom is on your Bench, you may draw a card. Then, discard all cards attached to Aipom and put Aipom on the bottom of your deck. You can't use more than 1 Snappy Move Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Snap Tail
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Cry for Help
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Water or Fighting Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex), show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Double Attack
attacks.text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Aqua Sonic
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Twin Play
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 in any combination of Scyther and Scyther ex and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Scyther during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Lullaby
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

ability.name: Energy Evolution
ability.text: Whenever you attach an Energy card from your hand to Eevee, you may search your deck for a card that evolves from Eevee that is the same type as the Energy card you attached to Eevee. Put that card onto Eevee. (This counts as evolving Eevee.) Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used when you attach an Energy card to Eevee as part of an attack's effect.

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: Flaaffy does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Smog
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Yawn
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Professor Elm's Training Method
text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Search your deck for an Evolution card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Minor Errand-Running
attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Stun Poison
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

cards.name: Warp Point
text: Your opponent switches 1 of his or her Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any. You switch 1 of your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon, if any.

cards.name: Potion
text: Remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon (remove 1 damage counter if that Pokémon has only 1).

cards.name: Typhlosion ex

ability.name: Bursting Up
ability.text: Once during your turn, when you play Typhlosion ex from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, count the number of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. You may search your deck for up to that number of Fire Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Fire Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Kindle
attacks.text: Discard an Energy card attached to Typhlosion ex and then discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Rocket's Persian ex

ability.name: Night Cry
ability.text: Once during your turn, if Rocket's Persian ex is on your Bench, you may search your deck for a Pokémon with Dark or Rocket's in its name. Show it to your opponent and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Toxic Claws
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on the Defending Pokémon between turns.

cards.name: Poké Ball
text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Basic Pokémon or Evolution card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Sacred Fire
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 60 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

attacks.name: Aeroblast
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Spearhead
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Surprise
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at the card you chose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

ability.name: Dense
ability.text: Any damage done to Quagsire by attacks from your opponent's Evolved Pokémon is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Rock Hurl
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Fishing Tail
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Basic Pokémon, Evolution card, or basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand.

attacks.name: Trip Over
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

cards.name: Curse Powder
text: Attach Curse Powder to 1 of your Evolved Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex) that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If the Pokémon Curse Powder is attached to is a Basic Pokémon or Pokémon-ex, discard Curse Powder.
If the Pokémon that Curse Powder is attached to is your Active Pokémon and is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, put 3 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

ability.name: Golden Wing
ability.text: If Ho-Oh ex would be Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, you may move up to 2 Energy attached to Ho-Oh ex to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Rainbow Burn
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 20 more damage for each type of basic Energy card attached to Ho-Oh ex.

attacks.name: Night Song
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch. The new Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Plunder
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Trainer cards attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Celebi ex
text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Spiral Leaf
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokemon. If tails, remove 1 damage country for each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Time Trap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, look at the top 4 cards of your opponent's deck, and put them back on top of your opponent's deck in any order. If tails, look at the top 4 cards of your deck, and put them back on top of your deck in any order.

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Aqua Supply
attacks.text: You may attach a basic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Multi Bubble
attacks.text: If Vaporeon has 3 or more different types of basic Energy cards attached to it, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

ability.name: Stages of Evolution
ability.text: As long as Hitmontop is an Evolved Pokémon, is your Active Pokémon, and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Hitmontop is Knocked Out), put 2 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Upward Kick
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has at least 2 damage counters on it, this attack does 20 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Spiral Kick
attacks.text: n/a

attacks.name: Screechy Voice
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is an Evolved Pokémon, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Push Away
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand, choose a Trainer card you find there, and discard it.

attacks.name: Energy Stream
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a basic Energy card and attach it to Lanturn.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Lanturn does 10 damage to itself.

ability.name: Extra Tight
ability.text: Prevent all damage done to Shuckle by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon-ex.

attacks.name: Toxic
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on the Defending Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: 3-D Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Paralyzing Gaze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Fireworks
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy card attached to Cyndaquil.

attacks.name: Dig Deep
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for an Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand.

cards.name: Mary's Request
text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Draw a card. If you don't have any Stage 2 Evolved Pokémon in play, draw 2 more cards.

attacks.name: Energy Ball
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Poliwhirl but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Splatter
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

cards.name: Energy Removal 2
text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and discard it.

cards.name: Energy Switch
text: Move a basic Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

cards.name: Fluffy Berry
text: Attach Fluffy Berry to 1 of your Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex and Pokémon that has Dark or an owner in its name) that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If the Pokémon Fluffy Berry is attached to is Pokémon-ex or has Dark or an owner in its name, discard Fluffy Berry.
As long as Fluffy Berry is attached to a Pokémon, that Pokémon's Retreat Cost is 0.

cards.name: Protective Orb
text: Attach Protective Orb to 1 of your Evolved Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex) that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If the Pokémon Protective Orb is attached to is a Basic Pokémon or Pokémon-ex, discard Protective Orb.
As long as Protective Orb is attached to a Pokémon, that Pokémon has no Weakness.

attacks.name: Lick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Metal Energy
text: Damage done by attacks to the Pokémon that Metal Energy is attached to is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). Ignore this effect if the Pokémon that Metal Energy is attached to isn't Metal. Metal Energy provides Metal Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

cards.name: Boost Energy
text: Boost Energy can be attached only to an Evolved Pokémon. Discard Boost Energy at the end of the turn it was attached. Boost Energy provides Colorless Colorless Colorless Energy. The Pokémon Boost Energy is attached to can't retreat. If the Pokémon Boost Energy is attached to isn't an Evolved Pokémon, discard Boost Energy.

cards.name: Cyclone Energy
text: Cyclone Energy provides Colorless Energy. When you attach this card from your hand to your Active Pokémon, switch 1 of the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Benched Pokémon to switch.

cards.name: Warp Energy
text: Warp Energy provides Colorless Energy. When you attach this card from your hand to your Active Pokémon, switch that Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Energy Search
text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Sitrus Berry
text: Attach Sitrus Berry to 1 of your Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex and Pokémon that has Dark or an owner in its name) that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If the Pokémon Sitrus Berry is attached to is Pokémon-ex or has Dark or an owner in its name, discard Sitrus Berry.
At any time between turns, if the Pokémon this card is attached to has at least 3 damage counters on it, remove 3 damage counters from it. Then, discard Sitrus Berry.

cards.name: Solid Rage
text: Attach Solid Rage to 1 of your Evolved Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex) that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If the Pokémon Solid Rage is attached to is a Basic Pokémon or Pokémon-ex, discard Solid Rage.
If you have more Prize cards left than your opponent, the Pokémon that Solid Rage is attached to does 20 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

ability.name: Super Suction Cups
ability.text: As long as Octillery is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Standing By
attacks.text: Discard an Energy card attached to Octillery. During your next turn, Octillery's Pulse Blast attack's base damage is 120.

attacks.name: Dazzle Dance
attacks.text: Each Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Green Blast
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Grass Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Attract Current
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Multi Pulse
attacks.text: If Jolteon has 3 or more different types of basic Energy cards attached to it, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Soothing Scent
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

ability.name: Dual Armor
ability.text: As long as Magcargo has any Fighting Energy attached to it, Magcargo is both Fire and Fighting type.

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Extra Flame
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage.

ability.name: Thick Fat
ability.text: Any damage done to Miltank by attacks from Fire Pokémon and Water Pokémon is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Healing Milk
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Grand Loop
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards. You may switch Yanma with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spinning Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

ability.name: Stages of Evolution
ability.text: As long as Hitmonchan is an Evolved Pokémon, Hitmonchan gets +30 HP.

attacks.name: Heavy Punch
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Speedy Uppercut
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Retaliate
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Larvitar.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Telekinesis
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Steelix ex

ability.name: Poison Resistance
ability.text: Steelix ex can't be Poisoned.

text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Metal Charge
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on Steelix ex.

attacks.name: Mudslide
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fighting Energy attached to Steelix ex and choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 100 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Energy Root
text: Attach Energy Root to 1 of your Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex and Pokémon that has Dark or an owner in its name) that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If the Pokémon Energy Root is attached to is Pokémon-ex or has Dark or an owner in its name, discard Energy Root.
As long as Energy Root is attached to a Pokémon, that Pokémon gets +20 HP and can't use any Poké-Powers or Poké-Bodies.

cards.name: Pokémon Reversal
text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch.

cards.name: Entei Star
text: You can't have more than 1 Pokémon Star in your deck.

attacks.name: Burning Turn
attacks.text: Switch Entei Star with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Detonation
attacks.text: If you have less Prize cards left than your opponent, discard the top 10 cards from your deck.

cards.name: Umbreon ex

ability.name: Darker Ring
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you play Umbreon ex from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch.

text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Black Cry
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat or use any Poké-Powers during your opponent's next turn.

ability.name: Baby Evolution
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Electabuzz from your hand onto Elekid (this counts as evolving Elekid) and remove all damage counters from Elekid.

attacks.name: Magnetic Trip
attacks.text: If Low Pressure System is in play, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Energy Recycle System
text: Search your discard pile for basic Energy cards. You may either show 1 basic Energy card to your opponent and put it into your hand, or show 3 basic Energy cards to your opponent and shuffle them into your deck.

cards.name: Darkness Energy
text: If the Pokémon Darkness Energy is attached to attacks, the attack does 10 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). Ignore this effect unless the Attacking Pokémon is Darkness or has Dark in its name. Darkness Energy provides Darkness Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

ability.name: Energy Connect
ability.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a basic Energy card attached to 1 of your Benched Pokémon to your Active Pokémon. This power can't be used if Ampharos is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Miraculous Thunder
attacks.text: You may discard all Lightning Energy attached to Ampharos. If you do, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned and Confused.

attacks.name: Reactive Poison
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 30 more damage for each Special Condition affecting the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spider Trap
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned. Before applying this effect, you may switch 1 of your opponent’s Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. If you do, the new Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch.

ability.name: Intimidating Fang
ability.text: As long as Feraligatr is your Active Pokémon, any damage done to your Pokémon by an opponent's attack is reduced by 10 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Pull Away
attacks.text: If your opponent has 5 or more cards in his or her hand, your opponent discards a number of cards until your opponent has 4 cards left in his or her hand.

attacks.name: Tonnage
attacks.text: You may do 50 damage plus 30 more damage. If you do, Feraligatr does 30 damage to itself.

ability.name: Lonesome
ability.text: As long as you have less Pokémon in play than your opponent, your opponent can't play any Trainer cards (except for Supporter cards) from his or her hand.

attacks.name: Tight Jaw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to Houndoom.

ability.name: Healing Aroma
ability.text: As long as Meganium is your Active Pokémon, remove 1 damage counter from each Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex) (both yours and your opponent's) between turns.

attacks.name: Bouncy Move
attacks.text: You may put up to 5 damage counters on Meganium. If you do, this attack does 50 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter you put on Meganium in this way.

ability.name: Spiral Swirl
ability.text: If Poliwrath is your Active Pokémon and is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, the Attacking Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Beatdown
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Darkness Pokémon or has Dark in its name, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Hyper Splash
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Stage 2 Evolved Pokémon, this attack does 60 damage plus 30 more damage.

ability.name: 3-D Reset
ability.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), return a Pokémon Tool card attached to 1 of your Pokémon to your hand. This power can't be used if Porygon2 is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Data Retrieval
attacks.text: If you have less than 8 cards in your hand, draw cards until you have 8 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Scramble Trip
attacks.text: If Porygon2 has a Scramble Energy card attached to it, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

ability.name: Dual Armor
ability.text: As long as Slowbro has any Psychic Energy attached to it, Slowbro is both Water and Psychic type.

attacks.name: Parallel Gain
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon (including Slowbro).

attacks.name: Copy
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. Copy copies that attack. This attack does nothing if Sudowoodo doesn't have the Energy necessary to use that attack. (You must still do anything else required for that attack.) Sudowoodo performs that attack.

attacks.name: Karate Chop
attacks.text: Does 50 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on Sudowoodo.

attacks.name: Hyper Healing
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter and all Special Conditions from each of your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Double Tackle
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Defending Pokémon.

ability.name: Baby Evolution
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Clefairy from your hand onto Cleffa (this counts as evolving Cleffa) and remove all damage counters from Cleffa.

attacks.name: Eeeeeeek
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck, then draw 6 cards.

ability.name: Stages of Evolution
ability.text: As long as Electabuzz is an Evolved Pokémon, damage done by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon that has any Special Energy cards attached to it is reduced by 40 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Double Shock
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads. If either of the coins is heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Luster Blast
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy attached to Electabuzz.

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

ability.name: Makeover
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a basic Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex). If you do, search your discard pile for a basic Energy card (excluding the one you discarded) and attach it to that Pokémon. This power can't be used if Smeargle is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Split Spiral Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

ability.name: Free Flight
ability.text: If Gligar has no Energy attached to it, Gligar's Retreat Cost is 0.

attacks.name: Toxic Grip
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Feraligatr ex

ability.name: Overpowering Fang
ability.text: As long as Feraligatr ex is your Active Pokémon, each player's Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex) can't use any Poké-Powers or Poké-Bodies.

text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Tsunami
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Sore Spot
attacks.text: Does 70 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.
